intro: Phacelia distans var. eudistans, commonly known as the silver phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its silvery-blue foliage and clusters of small, violet-blue flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant has a taproot system and thrives in well-drained soils, often found in open grasslands and rocky areas. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine, white hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. The species is valued for its ornamental appeal and role in supporting pollinators.
